item.title: Audio of Austin Appelbee's incredible Triple Zero call after marathon swim to save family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: More homes in Daly River damaged by flooding, with water levels expected to recede from Thursday
item.description: Floodwaters have spilled inside "quite a number of homes" in the remote Northern Territory town of Daly River, authorities say, with still-rising water levels delaying the return home for evacuated locals.

item.title: Transparency concerns as Bougainville's Panguna mine that sparked civil war on path to reopen
item.description: The Autonomous Bougainville Government signs a secretive deal to reopen the huge Panguna gold and copper mine that sparked a catastrophic civil war three decades ago.

item.title: Australia Diamonds defeat Jamaica 80-33 in third netball Test to claim 3-0 series win
item.description: Coach Stacey Marinkovich believes a refreshed Diamonds squad has found its "identity" ahead of attempting to become the first Australian netball team to defend Commonwealth Games gold.

item.title: Thirty people stranded by floods in outback NT angry at police
item.description: A day trip to the Tjoritja/West MacDonnell National Park became a 24-hour ordeal for almost 30 people when the Hugh River unexpectedly cut off Namatjira Drive, 50 kilometres from Alice Springs.

item.title: Animal abuse charge takes one year as RSPCA prosecutions in Queensland drastically decline
item.description: A man has been charged with animal cruelty a year after neighbours first made a complaint to the RSPCA.

item.title: James Van Der Beek, star of Dawson's Creek, dies aged 48 after colorectal cancer diagnosis
item.description: The American actor was best known for his starring role as Dawson Leery in Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003.

item.title: Authorities warn Alice Springs flash flooding threat isn't over, more Central Australian rain predicted
item.description: Authorities are warning Alice Springs could face further flooding overnight, with forecasts of more wet weather posing a threat to slowly receding water levels.

item.title: FBI combs desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
item.description: The man detained for questioning in the investigation into the disappearance of a US TV show host's mother has been released and the search continues.

item.title: Public DNA databases lead to arrest over historical NSW sexual assault cases
item.description: A 77-year-old man is arrested in connection with a string of alleged sexual assaults in NSW dating back to the 1990s.

item.title: Tasmanian man Corey Chugg found alive four days after going missing in bushland
item.description: The 32-year-old man went into a bushland with a friend to collect firewood on Sunday. Police say he has been found alive at the bottom of a steep incline.

item.title: James Van Der Beek was synonymous with his character. How he embraced it with humour will be his legacy
item.description: James Van Der Beek's death prompts wide-ranging tributes from co-stars and friends who have praised his kindness and humour.

item.description: Police allege the owner of a recently set up fishing company purchased a vessel with illicit funds to facilitate the importation of illegal drugs.

item.title: Liberals' leadership machinations dominate the political week
item.description: The Liberals have spent the week embroiled in leadership woes as the party braces for a spill on Friday morning.

item.title: Gas exploration seismic testing project rejected in south-west Victoria
item.description: A controversial seismic testing proposal off Victoria's south-west coast has been rejected in a "rare" move from the offshore regulator.

item.title: Barbeques Galore enters receivership as debt burns into bottom line
item.description: Barbeques Galore has plunged into receivership, leaving question marks for nearly 100 stores that employ about 500 staff.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man charged over alleged sexual assault of girl on Adelaide bus
item.description: A 33-year-old man is expected to face an Adelaide court on Friday, after a teenage girl was allegedly sexually assaulted on a public bus earlier this week.

item.title: Drone vision from Alice Springs shows vehicles trapped by flooding
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Liberal Party poised to dump first female federal leader
item.description: The Liberal Party is poised to dump its first federal female leader, with Sussan Ley's supporters acknowledging her rival, Angus Taylor, is in the "ascendancy".

item.title: ASX boss to depart as another controversy unfolds
item.description: A decade of technology failures, unplanned outages, management upheaval, irate investors and the torching of hundreds of millions of dollars has left the ASX's reputation in shreds.

item.title: Epstein survivor says release of files was 're-traumatising' and falls short of transparency
item.description: Lisa Phillips says the publication of the "Epstein" files was meant to deliver long-promised transparency but has instead exposed victims, deepened trauma and continued to shield powerful men.

item.title: Economist Bruce Preston appointed to RBA Board
item.description: The economics professor is the second academic economist added to the board since a review recommended boosting its expertise.

item.title: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors gather for apology anniversary
item.description: More than 100 Stolen Generations survivors have gathered in Canberra for the apology anniversary. The government is pledging new money to help them heal.

item.title: What a 566yo coolabah tree in the Gwydir Wetlands could tell us about climate
item.description: New research shows some of the coolabahs and river red gums in the Gwydir Wetlands, New South Wales are hundreds of years old, and hold important climate history.

item.title: NT Australian of the Year Felix Ho volunteers thousands of hours to the community each year
item.description: Finding time to volunteer can be a stretch for most people, but for Darwin doctor Felix Ho, who volunteers thousands of hours every year, it's his "full-time hobby".

item.title: Thai raid finds Cambodian scam centre had personal details of 300 Australians
item.description: Australia's National Anti-Scam Centre says documents seized in a raid on a Cambodian scam compound contained the phone numbers, names and addresses of 300 Australians.

item.title: Why do some regional councils charge for car parking in country towns, while others don't?
item.description: Parking meters have been ripped out in some country towns, while in others, motorists are still being slugged, and retailers are feeling the pinch.

item.title: From new life to grief, Ella Macens's music for the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra is rooted in love
item.description: After experiencing the Bondi terror attack in December, this composer's new music grew to encompass love's power to heal us from hate and harm.

item.title: Raymond Reddington blamed wife Sharon Fulton's disappearance on serial killers David and Catherine Birnie, court told
item.description: Notorious Perth serial killers David and Catherine Birnie could not be ruled out as suspects in the alleged murder of a woman who vanished the same year they killed four young women, the detective who arrested them says.

item.title: Keen to declutter this year? Here's how to start
item.description: Experts say you don't need to pull out the entire contents of a cupboard, beginning with one bag is best.

item.title: Albemarle lithium refinery closure gives WA government a critical minerals reality check
item.description: It was once hoped WA would be in the "box seat" to process critical minerals like lithium. So why are processors like Albemarle pulling the pin?

item.title: Angus Taylor becomes Liberal leader after defeating Sussan Ley 34–17
item.description: Sussan Ley, the first female leader of the Liberal Party, is set to quit politics after losing a leadership vote today.

item.title: Former Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Spurs 'not a big club' in wake of Thomas Frank sacking
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.title: Alice Springs woman survives 12-hour flood ordeal on Todd River
item.description: When her mother was swept into the flooding Todd River this week, Alice Springs woman Latarne Wayne went in after her.

item.description: Sussan Ley vowed to be a different opposition leader, one who consulted widely and listened to her broad church. But it left many wondering what, if anything, she stood for.

item.title: FBI raises reward to $US100,000 in suspected abduction of Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: The FBI increases its reward and releases new images as part of its investigation into the suspected abduction of US television host Savannah Guthrie's mother, Nancy, from her southern Arizona home.

item.title: Ley leaves Taylor an immediate electoral test with Farrer by-election
item.description: Within two hours of being elected Liberal leader, Angus Taylor has already been delivered his first big electoral test, and it has come from the woman he deposed.

item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won a landmark parliamentary election, according to local TV stations, securing a resounding mandate in a pivotal vote.

item.title: AFL Origin 2026: Are footy fans still keen on interstate football?
item.description: After a break of more than a quarter of a century, AFL State of Origin returns in Perth tomorrow with a battle between two proud football states, Western Australia and Victoria.

item.title: What to know about the Year of the Horse and Lunar New Year celebrations in Australia
item.description: The Year of the Horse is here and 2026 is a rare "Red Horse" year. Find out what it means, which zodiac animal you are, and how Lunar New Year is celebrated across Australia.

item.title: Christopher Mark Jordan, accused of murdering Shyanne-Lee Tatnell, expected to stand trial in September
item.description: A man who has pleaded not guilty to murdering a 14-year-old girl could stand trial as early as September, the Supreme Court in Launceston has heard.

item.title: Kitchen hand charged with attempted murder, stalking over alleged stabbing at Brisbane leagues club
item.description: Cameron William Leslie Clark, 33, remains in hospital after the alleged incident at Easts Leagues Club in the inner-city Brisbane suburb of Coorparoo.

item.title: Flower industry peak body pushes for country of origin labelling amid Valentine's Day rush
item.description: Millions of red roses will fly off florists' shelves this weekend, but the flower industry says there is not much to tell customers where the flowers are from.

item.description: By its new leader Angus Taylor's own admission, the Liberal Party is running out of time to pull out of the nosedive that has it heading towards oblivion.

item.title: Australia in danger of World Cup elimination after 'unbelievable' loss to Zimbabwe
item.description: Australia's hopes of advancing out of Group B are dealt an almighty blow as Zimbabwe claims one of the biggest upset wins in T20 World Cup history in Colombo.

item.title: US man linked to Wieambilla shooting sentenced to three years' prison
item.description: A US-based conspiracy theorist with links to the Wieambilla shooters is handed a three-year sentence for firearms offences.

item.title: Out of 38,000 people fined for non-voting in NT local government elections just 3 per cent have paid
item.description: Just 3 per cent of voters fined for not voting in last year’s Northern Territory local government elections have paid the penalty. Debate is growing over whether the system is working — or unfair to voters in remote areas.

item.description: Oliver Phommavanh is sentenced to six-and-a-half years in prison with a non-parole period of four years.

item.description: Detectives say the son of a 69-year-old woman found dead in Albany is being treated as a suspect in her alleged homicide.

item.title: Coroner finds police tactic not the cause of Toowoomba Indigenous man's death in custody
item.description: A Queensland coroner finds the cause of Indigenous man Steven Nixon-McKellar's death during an arrest was "multi-factorial".

item.title: Ley didn't define herself by her gender but women might relate to her workplace woes
item.description: The issue for the Liberal Party is not simply the toppling of a female leader. It's also about what happened to that leader while she was in the job.

item.title: From Japan to Israel, elections are reshaping global politics
item.description: At a time when so much of the global conversation is about the rapid decline of democracy, it is striking what a huge impact elections are having on world events just now.

item.title: Josie Baff wins 2026 Winter Olympic gold, a testament to the power of self-belief
item.description: Self-belief is the most powerful tool at an athlete's disposal, and Josie Baff utilised it to its fullest extent with a magical run to gold in the 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard cross.

item.description: As record numbers of Australians continue to visit Japan, Japanese brewers have come to dominate our domestic beer market.

item.description: Scotty James has fallen short of an elusive Olympic gold, instead claiming a second silver medal in the snowboard halfpipe.

But some businesses along Jetty Road are still hurting from the disruptions.

item.description: Six decades ago, Australia swapped its old currency for dollars and cents. A catchy jingle sung by a cartoon character named Dollar Bill helped the country adapt.

item.description: Victoria holds off a spirited WA side to win the first Aussie rules State of Origin clash for 27 years, though the game is marred by a serious injury to Carlton star Jacob Weitering.

item.description: With fires and floods occurring simultaneously, and overlapping with international deployments, sharing critical resources is becoming an increasingly complex task.

item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned by the Kremlin with a rare and lethal toxin found in the skin of poison dart frogs, five European countries have said. It's not the first time the country has been accused of poisoning its enemies.

item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.description: Floods cause power outages, road collapses, home evacuations and are linked to the death of a man whose vehicle was submerged on a highway.

item.description: Matt Graham's medal is the third Australia’s moguls squad has delivered at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.description: Two people are wounded in an attack on the port of Taman in the Krasnodar region, ahead of US-brokered peace talks between Ukraine and Russia.

item.description: The "case of the century" is set to play out in the federal court this month, with the ACCC taking on supermarket giant Coles for what it claims are "illusory" discounts.

item.title: AI is evolving fast and may bring the fourth industrial revolution with it
item.description: A fake news story about me, a series of AI breakthroughs and a resignation in the tech world show that 2026 could be pivotal for AI.

item.title: Alex de Minaur claims Rotterdam Open with impressive victory over Felix Auger-Aliassime
item.description: An inspired Alex de Minaur produces one of the biggest wins of his career, lifting the Rotterdam Open title by beating red-hot Felix Auger-Aliassime.

item.title: Whooping cough cases hit record high after 'potentially catastrophic' vaccine rate drop
item.description: A "potentially catastrophic" decline in Australia's childhood vaccination rates has contributed to the sharpest increase in cases of whooping cough in 35 years, infectious diseases experts say.

item.title: As high-speed rail plans gather pace, Britain's HS2 offers hard lessons
item.description: While the federal government considers an ambitious plan, a similar project in the UK has seen its fair share of controversies.

item.title: Australia defeated by India in opening T20 as Sophie Molineux era gets off to wobbly start
item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.title: From wheels to waves in Australia's queer spaces
item.description: In places marked by historic violence and exclusion, queer communities are still showing up.

item.title: Box Hill North players' sanctions over inappropriate photos criticised as 'extremely lenient'
item.description: The Box Hill North Football Club players involved in inappropriate photos posted online after their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations have been sanctioned by the league's governing body.

item.title: Cousin of Westfield Bondi Junction attack victim feels many questions were left unanswered at inquest
item.description: A bereaved family member of victim Jade Young feels many of his questions surrounding the deadly attack and its aftermath have been left unanswered from the inquest.

item.title: India and Pakistan refuse handshakes before and after contentious T20 World Cup clash
item.description: India and Pakistan decline to shake hands before and after the most-anticipated game of the T20 World Cup, with India easily winning by 61 runs to secure its Super 8 spot.

item.title: Cape Barren Island uses greenhouse and traditional foods to keep fridges full
item.description: A tiny island off the coast of Tasmania is embracing old and new techniques to keep food on the table.

item.title: 'Utterly misleading': ACCC argues case against Coles 'discounts', ASX marginally higher — as it happened
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles and the consumer watchdog are in the Federal Court. The ASX closes marginally higher after a busy session of results.

item.title: Dams and rivers run dry, forcing Victorian farmers to make tough decisions about their livestock
item.description: Victorian farmers are forced to cart water or destock as dams and rivers run dry.

item.title: DNA recovered from glove found near Guthrie home that appears to match suspect's glove, FBI says
item.description: The FBI says a glove containing DNA was found near the home of US TV show host Savannah Guthrie's mother and appears to match those worn by a masked person outside her front door the night she vanished.

item.title: How the ABC Young Performers Awards helped launch the careers of these Australian musicians
item.description: The ABC Young Performers Awards have launched the careers of some of Australia's most successful musicians. Here are some of their stories.

item.title: Fisheries compliance officers inspection November 2023
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Future of fishing prosecutions unclear after multi-million-dollar abalone trafficking case collapses
item.description: Subpoenaed documents obtained by the ABC reveal NSW Police continued prosecuting seven men for illegally trafficking abalone despite advice that their case was likely to fail.

item.title: Why Australian Adam Lambert's medal-losing crash in the final made him feel better about his Winter Olympics
item.description: Adam Lambert's crash in the mixed snowboard cross cost Australia a chance at a medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games, but it still makes him feel better about his campaign.

item.title: Chalmers mocks Taylor's proposal for bipartisan budget savings taskforce
item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.title: Halls Gap businesses reinventing themselves after bushfires wiped out trade
item.description: After two consecutive summers devastated by bushfires, businesses in the region are reinventing themselves to stay afloat.

item.title: SA Police return to Oak Park Station in Gus Lamont missing person investigation
item.description: Officers are at Oak Park Station in South Australia's north-east, where a four-year-old boy went missing almost five months ago.

item.title: Meet GayC/DC, the world's only all-gay AC/DC tribute band
item.description: They worship the riffs, rewrite the lyrics and win over the toughest crowds. GayC/DC is a tribute band like no other.

item.title: Israeli air strikes target Gaza Palestinians just days before Board of Peace meeting
item.description: US President Donald Trump says the first meeting of his newly created Board of Peace will take place on Thursday, with over $7 billion to be pledged for reconstruction and humanitarian efforts in Gaza.

item.title: Traditional owners 'won't accept' handback of rehabilitated Argyle diamond mine site
item.description: East Kimberley traditional owners are concerned Rio Tinto's closure plan will leave them with "a giant hole in the ground forever".

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Matt Graham on dual moguls 'dad podium' as weather forces reschedule — quick hits from day nine
item.description: A trio of dads fill the dual moguls podium as an "unfavourable" forecast leaves things up in the air. Here are the quick hits from day nine of the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Vermilion's Wandoo gas exports halted after December oil spill
item.description: Exports from an oil field off WA's Pilbara are at a standstill after an oil spill in December. The regulator says it has identified "systemic failures" at the Canadian-owned Wandoo facility.

item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack gunman Naveed Akram appears in court for the first time
item.description: Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram, who is charged with 15 counts of murder, has appeared via video link for the first time in a Sydney court as a senior magistrate extended existing suppression orders in the case.

item.title: Police make 'very strange' appeal for return of kidnapped 85yo Sydney man
item.description: Detectives believe Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his bedroom just after 5am on Friday by intruders who forced their way into his North Ryde property.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: Brett Pointing to replace Steve Gollschewski as Queensland police commissioner on 12-month interim basis
item.description: Brett Pointing has been named as the interim Queensland police commissioner after Steve Gollschewski announced his retirement.

item.title: New tobacco laws proposed by WA government to target stores selling illegal cigarettes, vapes
item.description: Western Australia could soon have some of the nation's toughest illegal tobacco penalties, including fines of up to $21 million and hefty prison terms for possessing commercial quantities of illicit products.

item.title: Senior Liberals deny involvement in draft policy to ban migrants from Gaza
item.description: A leaked copy of the Liberal Party's migration policy prepared before Sussan Ley was ousted included plans to "elevate" the current non-binding Australian values statement.

item.title: NRL opens door for New Zealand and England internationals to play State of Origin
item.description: New South Wales and Queensland can now select players who are New Zealand and England internationals after the NRL confirmed a major change to the State of Origin eligibility rules.

item.title: Increased use of pepper spray, police weapons at protests alarm rights groups
item.description: Alarmed by a spike in pepper spray use and threats of sound cannons at protests, human rights groups want a review of "less lethal" weapons for crowd control.

item.title: ACCC accuses Coles of 'planned' campaign to mislead customers
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is accused of a "planned" campaign to mislead customers over discounts on the first day of a bombshell Federal Court case.

item.title: CCTV captures movement in street night Chris Baghsarian was abducted
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Canberra man accused of stalking couple and leaving them notes denied bail in ACT Magistrates Court
item.description: The man allegedly went to the married couple's home four times in two months, seeking access while claiming to be an arborist on one occasion, and attempting to remove the home's doorbell camera on another.

item.title: From the weird to the wonderful, here are nine times politicians have become a meme
item.description: From the downright weird to the speech that soared, Australia's politicians are under constant scrutiny. Here are some startling moments when the politician became the meme.

item.title: Man accused of Caboolture museum heist allegedly believed it was his 'duty' to return artefacts to 'rightful place', court told
item.description: Miguel Simon Mungarrieta Monsalve has been charged with a range of offences after he allegedly broke into a Caboolture museum on Friday morning.

item.title: Maugean skate still faces 'catastrophic' risk from salmon farming, Commonwealth advice says
item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.title: 'Signal sniffers' used in search for missing person Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker
item.description: The FBI is using "sophisticated" technology to try to locate Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker, as the search for the mother of US TV host Savannah Guthrie enters its third week.

item.title: Hospital boss says changes already made at child gender service criticised in review
item.description: Advocates have called for for better regional services after a Cairns children gender clinic was restricted following a scathing report.

item.title: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys fined almost $20,000 after leaving two divers in ocean
item.description: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys is fined almost $20,000 after an Australian Maritime Safety Authority probe found it took the crew on board 10 minutes to realise two divers had been left behind.

item.title: Firearms charges laid amid search for Gus Lamont, SA Police say unrelated to disappearance
item.description: Detectives investigating the case of missing boy Gus Lamont have made an arrest during their renewed search for evidence – but say it does not relate to his disappearance.

item.title: Heat, storms lead to extreme fire forecast across dry Victoria tomorrow
item.description: Almost half the state is expected to face extreme fire conditions tomorrow due to a mix of heat, dry fuels and gusty afternoon storms.

item.title: Protester takes to roof of Geraldton fisheries building over WA government's demersal fishing ban
item.description: A Geraldton fisherman locks himself to the roof of a government building — and says he has swallowed the key — in a protest over Cook government restrictions.

item.title: How cheating allegations have rocked the curling teams at the Olympics
item.description: Controversy is swirling in curling at the Winter Olympics after the Canadian team was accused of cheating. Here's a look at the whole controversy and why it matters.

item.title: Wotjobaluk Nations and Tati Tati formally enter Victorian Treaty negotiations register
item.description: Wotjobaluk Nations and Tati Tati traditional owners have joined Victoria's formal Treaty negotiations register, building on decades of work towards recognition and self-determination.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 10
item.description: Find out what is on during Day 10 at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Raymond Reddington murder trial hears evidence of marriage breakdown between him and Sharon Fulton
item.description: A Perth court hears a woman who was allegedly murdered by her husband 40 years ago initiated separation proceedings in 1985, the year before she went missing.

item.title: ABC Radio Perth will move to 102.5FM from February 23
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: NSW Police chases under scrutiny after two women die in crash as data shows rise in practice
item.description: Lee Casuscelli and Maureen Crosland died when their car was hit in Camden by an allegedly stolen car that police had been pursuing.

item.title: Remote WA communities isolated and roads closed after weekend deluge
item.description: Major roads and remote communities are cut off by floodwaters after a deluge of rain in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: Canberra woman allegedly held captive for two days and raped was 'subdued with violence', court hears
item.description: A Canberra man accused of forcibly confining a woman in his home for two days, sexually assaulting her and threatening to kill her and her family faces trial.

item.title: Police renew call for information about fatal 2023 house fire in Orange
item.description: NSW Police renew their appeal for information about a suspicious house fire in 2023 that killed a woman and injured her two children.

item.title: Gold Coast 'can't stop growth' but needs 185,000 new homes, according to council
item.description: The Gold Coast council plans to push more high-density housing inland to cope with a population surge to 1 million, amid warnings infrastructure is not keeping up.

item.title: Stepson tells hearing terminally ill man 'wanted to be done' as wife committed to stand trial for his murder
item.description: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs has been committed to stand trial for the murder of her husband David Mobbs, who had motor neurone disease, after he was allegedly given a fatal dose of medication.

item.title: Flotilla of foreign fishing boats spotted in Torres Strait waters
item.description: A surge in suspected illegal fishing activity puts the Torres Strait and Far North Queensland on high alert, with residents reporting multiple foreign vessels.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Anjan Paudel speaking on ABC Radio Darwin
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: CLP announces Anjan Paudel as Nightcliff by-election candidate, Phil Scott runs as independent
item.description: More candidates for the Nightcliff by-election are announced, with Phil Scott running as an independent and the Country Liberal Party preselecting Anjan Paudel, who has stumbled while answering basic policy questions.

item.title: Former FBI agents say looking closer at Nancy Guthrie's social circle may be key to finding her
item.description: As the FBI continues searching for kidnapped 84-year-old Nancy Guthrie in the United States, a former FBI negotiator says they will be focusing on the grandmother's social circle and family.

item.title: Live: Women's curling kicks off day 10 of the Winter Olympics
item.description: Curling, alpine skiing and short-track skating are all on the agenda early in Milano-Cortina as the Winter Olympics continues. Follow live.

item.title: What happened to Nancy Guthrie?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: The ABC can reveal Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters have left a camp in north-eastern Syria, and will try to begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: New Coalition leader Angus Taylor denies knowledge of Ley government immigration policy
item.description: Opposition leader Angus Taylor says he doesn't know anything about Sussan Ley's proposed immigration policy and that "more supply" is key to solving Australia's housing crisis.
